text:
On 12/17/2024 at 10:28 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/17/2024 at 10:28 AM)
Subject:Re: Fidelity acct - msft dividends and share deposit
Can you check the msft Fidelity account. The dividend was not transferred out.
On 12/17/2024 at 08:59 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/17/2024 at 10:26 AM)
Subject:Re: Fidelity acct - msft dividends and share deposit
I thought I already paid you the difference in 52/48? Isn’t that explained in the email?
On 12/17/2024 at 08:57 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/17/2024 at 08:58 AM)
Subject:Fidelity acct - msft dividends and share deposit
Can you transfer my 52% of the 2,892 msft dividend paid on Dec 12 that remains in the account. 52% is equal to 1,503.
There is less in the account now as you have some personal expenses deducting from it.
If you are still confirming with Lisa if it is 50/50 split versus a 52/48 split, can you transfer 1,446 now then wait for confirmation.
There was also a deposit of 14.959 shares on Dec 2. My share per agreement was to be 52% however fidelity split 50%. Please let me know what
Lisa view on this as this will impact future drops.
Thank you
Message 190 of 287
You have threads and asks across two platforms and multiple entries. Last Thursday I consolidated everything I could find into one place so we could
keep our running list format.
Now issues are fragmented again, you are missing key details, and you won’t agree to the solution that has worked in the past- the running list
meeting. I don’t get why, but it’s your call.
I want to work with you but I’m not doing it this way. It takes up too much time, energy, and explanation in the back and forth. Please suggest
something better than what we know works.
Happy to resolve our issues, but if it is your prerogative to say that you refuse the organized and structured way that works, it is also mine to push
back on something that clearly does not.
Our inability to execute even the most mundane tasks even while I say “screw it, I’ll pay you to make it go away” is a testament to why we need the
help you have refused for over a year now.
I don’t know how many times I have typed up the definition of insanity you used to quote to me, but I know you know it well. I’m asking for
something different. I want “>31” instead.
Sent:12/17/2024 at 12:55 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/17/2024 at 02:41 PM)
Subject:Running List
